page.title: 10HOUSE SURVEY 2
page.content: 3.What are the houses made of? -The majority-(59 houses)were breeze block/rendered.Next with 29 houses were stone rendered houses.Two were asbestos and one concrete.There were no ordinary brick houses. The stone was mostly brown slate or shillet and some pieces of granite, especially at the corners. On the older houses, brick was used for decoration and for window framing and corners. 4. What are the rooves made of? -32 houses had genuine slate. 30 (of the more modern) houses had composition tiles. 22 houses had asbestos tiles (about 40-50 years old). No houses in the village had thatched rooves. 2 ( of the oldest houses) had plastic slates. Terra cotta in bright brown used on the older houses as decoration.
